column2: An honorary title officially in charge of the royal hatchery, though actual duties are actual performed by lower nursery attendants and midwives.
The king's royal hunting pack assist and attend him on hunts
Without written lore, the loremaster is tasked with memorizing your realms oral religious traditions.
Officially the Fan-Bearer to the Right of the King is a highly prestigious position symbolically shading and fanning the king, though the actual fanning is often done by a servant.
The position of the censor is charged with maintaining the census and supervising public morality
The Curule Aedile is the official in charge of maintaining public building and regulating public festivals.

Attack your rival and attempt to steal their wealth.
Sharing much of their theology with Catholics, but worshiping the fallen archangel Lucifer instead of The Holy Trinity, Satanists are despised throughout the Christian world.
A very loosely organized belief system centered around spirits and magic, the dark rituals of Voodoo are largely feared throughout the world.

The ancient Egyptians worshiped a pantheon of gods including Ra, Osiris, and Anubis. While their religion was loosely defined and not highly uniform, it remained dominant in Egypt for over 3,000 years before the common era.

Under the rule of Akhenaten, it was declared the Aten, Ra-Horakhy who rejoices in the horizon, in his Name as the Light which is the sun disk, would be the sole god of Egypt.  With the rise of many monotheistic religions, this idea has once again gained prominence

The Jotnar faith shares almost all mythology with that of Norse pagans. Both groups believe in several distinct otherworldly realms, among them Asgard and Jotunnheim. While the Norse worship Odin and Thor, the lords of Asgard, the Jotnar worship the giants of Jotunnheim, among them Loki, Jormundgandr, and Fenrir.

The Jotnar faith shares almost all mythology with that of Norse pagans. Both groups believe in several distinct otherworldly realms, among them Asgard and Jotunnheim. While the Norse worship Odin and Thor, the lords of Asgard, the Jotnar worship the giants of Jotunnheim, among them Loki, Jormundgandr, and Fenrir.

The Hellenistic religion is polytheistic, with a pantheon of twelve major gods including Zeus, Aries, Athena, and Poseidon. It originated in ancient Greece and with the conquests of Alexander the Great and the Roman Empire, it would go on to become the dominant religion in the Mediterranean world until the rise of Christendom.

The Roman religion is polytheistic, with a pantheon of twelve major gods including Jupiter, Mars, Minerva, and Neptune. It originated as a blend of ancient Roman beliefs with the pantheon of the Greek religion, with the addition of an Imperial Cult venerating former emperors as gods.  It was the offical religion of the Roman Empire until its official conversion to Christianity under Emperor Theodosius I.

Celtic paganism is one of the last surviving branch of the ancient druidic belief systems. It features a pantheon of gods and a world full of spirits in which the children of Don rule the Skies, the Earth and the Otherworld. The main gods are Don and Lud, parents of the gods, Beli, the god of Healing, the Great Queen Rhiannon, the Horned god, called Amanaeth, Manawydan, the Sea God and Lleu of the Skillful Hand.

The reformed Celtic faith has a standardized liturgy etched on the many raised stones on the British Isles, telling the story of Don and her children. It is led by the circle of the Druids with the Arch-Druid as the religious leader of the faithful.

The draconic faith is similar to many forms of European paganism and shares in many of their myths and legends.  However, instead of venerating the great heroes of men, it instead venerators the dragons in those tales.  The rituals of this religion are primarily concerned with the aquisition of precious metals as a way of strengthening ones soul for the next world and views fire as a sacred, cleansing force.

The reformed draconic faith adopts standardized texts and rituals concerned with the purification and strengthening of the soul.  It views the world as a giant egg, and when it hatches, a new world will be born and everyone's place will be determines by their wealth in the old one.

As the head of the Blood Court, you may call your council to join your wars.  They are not obligated to join you.

Adopting Draconic Feudalism will convert all my Tribal Holdings into Castles. Where this occurs - if the County is big enough - City and Temple Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Your same rank tributaries will have their higher titles seized and your tributaries will be made into vassals. Your vassals are likely to follow suit if they are of your religion and culture.

Adopting Draconic Feudalism will convert all my Tribal Holdings into Castles. Where this occurs - if the County is big enough - City and Temple Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Your same rank tributaries will have their higher titles seized and your tributaries will be made into vassals. Your vassals are likely to follow suit if they are of your religion and culture.

Adopting Draconic Mercantilism will convert all my Tribal Holdings into Cities. Where this occurs - if the County is big enough - Castle and Temple Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Four suitable Patrician families will be founded from within my tributes.

In Werewolf culture, vassals may challenge rulers who are seen as unfit to rule.  If victorious, they may seize control of their realm.  Laws may be put in place to restrict when this can be done.
Traditionally, challenges may be brought against new, incapable, infamous, child, deformed, or weak rulers
With this law, poor prestige or tyrannical rule are no longer grounds for a challenge
With this law, challenges may only be brought against adults.
With this law, genetic physical deformity is no longer grounds for a challenge
Under restricted challenge laws, challenges may only be made once per lifetime, and only against new, incapable, or non-werewolf rulers.
Rulers may be challenged over tyranny or negative prestige
Rulers may no longer be challenged over tyranny or negative prestige
Challenges may be brought against child rulers
Challenges may no longer be brought against child rulers
Rulers may be challenged over physical deformity
Rulers may no longer be challenged over physical deformity
Rulers may be challenged over physical weakness
Rulers may no longer be challenged over physical weakness
New rulers may be challenged for 5 years
New rulers may be challenged for 4 years
New rulers may be challenged for 3 years
Challengers must wait 2 years before issuing another challenge
Challengers must wait 3 years before issuing another challenge
Challengers must wait 4 years before issuing another challenge
Challengers must wait 5 years before issuing another challenge
Challengers may only issue a challenge once per lifetime.

The character has a well developed sense of justice - a trait much respected by vassals and courtiers.[ViceVirtue_Just]
column3: Ce personnage se caractérise par un sens aigu de la justice, ce qui lui vaut le respect de ses vassaux et courtisans.[ViceVirtue_Just]
column4: Der Gerechtigkeitssinn dieses Charakters ist gut ausgebildet - eine von Vasallen und Höflingen sehr geschätzte Eigenschaft.[ViceVirtue_Just]
column6: El personaje tiene un gran sentido de la justicia, un rasgo muy respetado entre vasallos y cortesanos.[ViceVirtue_Just]

column2: This character could not care less about justice - a character flaw that is not appreciated by vassals and courtiers.[ViceVirtue_Arbitrary]
column3: Ce personnage se moque de la justice, ce qui exaspère ses vassaux et ses courtisans.[ViceVirtue_Arbitrary]
column4: Dieser Charakter schert sich nicht um Gerechtigkeit  ein Charaktermakel, der von Vasallen und Höflingen nicht geschätzt wird.[ViceVirtue_Arbitrary]
column6: A este personaje no le podría importar menos la justicia, un defecto no apreciado entre vasallos y cortesanos.[ViceVirtue_Arbitrary]

column2: Lust, or 'Luxuria', the first deadly sin, enflames this character. These carnal desires are not appreciated by the Church, and might also cause problems out of the marital bed...[ViceVirtue_Lustful]
column3: La luxure, 'luxuria' en latin, enflamme ce personnage. De tels plaisirs charnels ne sont pas du goût de l'Église et peuvent être la source de nombreux problème en dehors du lit conjugal...[ViceVirtue_Lustful]
column4: Dieser Charakter wird von der Begierde, oder "Luxuria" getrieben - der ersten Todsünde. Diese Fleischeslüste werden von der Kirche nicht geschätzt und könnten auch außerhalb des Ehebetts zu Problemen führen ...[ViceVirtue_Lustful]
column6: El deseo sexual o 'luxuria', el primer pecado capital, invade a este personaje. Estos deseos carnales no están bien vistos por la Iglesia y pueden causar problemas fuera del matrimonio...[ViceVirtue_Lustful]

column2: Chastity, or 'Castitas' is the first of the seven virtues. Chaste characters are admired for their virtue and are unlikely to have extramarital affairs.[ViceVirtue_Chaste]
column3: À l'opposé de la luxure, la chasteté, 'castitas' en latin, est vue d'un bon il et permet d'éviter les aventures extraconjugales.[ViceVirtue_Chaste]
column4: Keuschheit, bzw. "Castitas", ist die erste der sieben Tugenden. Keusche Charaktere werden für ihre Tugend bewundert und haben eher weniger außereheliche Affären.[ViceVirtue_Chaste]
column6: La castidad o 'castitas' es la primera de las siete virtudes. Los personajes castos son admirados por su virtud y es improbable que tengan relaciones extramatrimoniales.[ViceVirtue_Chaste]

column2: Pride, 'Superbia' is the seventh deadly sin according to the Church. However, proud characters tend to be ambitious and work hard to increase their Prestige.[ViceVirtue_Proud]
column3: L'orgueil, 'superbia' en latin, est le septième péché capital. Le bon côté, c'est qu'un personnage orgueilleux travaillera très dur pour améliorer son prestige.[ViceVirtue_Proud]
column4: Stolz, oder "Superbia", ist nach Ansicht der Kirche die siebte Todsünde. Stolze Charaktere tendieren aber dazu, ehrgeizig zu sein und hart für mehr Prestige zu arbeiten.[ViceVirtue_Proud]
column6: El orgullo o 'superbia' es el séptimo pecado capital según la Iglesia. Sin embargo, los personajes orgullosos suelen ser ambiciosos y trabajan duro para subir su Prestigio.[ViceVirtue_Proud]

column2: Humility, or 'Humilitas', is the seventh virtue and the opposite of Pride. Humble characters gain [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] where the proud gain Prestige. Humble characters tend to dislike prideful ones.[ViceVirtue_Humble]
column3: L'humilité, 'humilitas' en latin, est la septième vertu. L'humble travaille dur pour améliorer sa [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] et a tendance à ne pas apprécier l'orgueilleux.[ViceVirtue_Humble]
column4: Bescheidenheit oder "Humilitas" ist die siebte Tugend und das Gegenteil von Stolz. Bescheidene Charaktere erlangen [Player.Religion.GetPietyName], die stolzen Prestige. Bescheidene Charaktere tendieren zur Verachtung von stolzen Charakteren.[ViceVirtue_Humble]
column6: La humildad o 'humilitas' es la séptima virtud opuesta al orgullo. Los personajes humildes ganan [Player.Religion.GetPietyName], mientras que los orgullosos obtienen prestigio. Los primeros suelen rechazar a los últimos.[ViceVirtue_Humble]

column2: Gluttony, or 'Gula', is the second deadly sin and lacks positive effects. The Church despises gluttons, and so do members of the opposite sex.[ViceVirtue_Gluttonous]
column3: La gourmandise, 'gula' en latin, est le deuxième péché capital. Aucune vertu ne la rachète puisqu'à la fois les religieux et le sexe opposé la trouvent répugnante.[ViceVirtue_Gluttonous]
column4: Völlerei, oder "Gula", ist die zweite Todsünde und hat keine positiven Effekte. Sie wird von der Kirche und vom anderen Geschlecht verachtet.[ViceVirtue_Gluttonous]
column6: La glotonería o 'gula' es el segundo pecado capital y carece de efectos positivos. La Iglesia aborrece a los glotones, así como los miembros del sexo opuesto.[ViceVirtue_Gluttonous]

column2: Ambitious characters work harder, making them better at everything. However, their drive to reach the top means that they tend to make poor vassals...[ViceVirtue_Ambitious]
column3: Obsédé par sa réussite, ce personnage est souvent meilleur que les autres. Et comme il en est conscient, il fait rarement un bon vassal.[ViceVirtue_Ambitious]
column4: Ehrgeizige Charaktere arbeiten härter, weswegen sie bei allem besser sind. Ihr Streben an die Spitze macht sie allerdings zu dürftigen Vasallen ...[ViceVirtue_Ambitious]
column6: Los personajes ambiciosos trabajan duro y mejoran en aquello que se propongan. Sin embargo, este anhelo por llegar a la cima los convierte en malos vasallos...[ViceVirtue_Ambitious]

column2: Content characters are satisfied with their lot in life. They make loyal vassals but are unsuited to intrigue.[ViceVirtue_Content]
column3: Ce personnage se contente de la vie qu'il mène, ce qui en fait un vassal loyal, mais le rend inapte à l'intrigue.[ViceVirtue_Content]
column4: Zufriedene Charaktere sind mit ihrem Leben zufrieden. Sie geben gute Vasallen ab, sind aber nicht für Intrigen geeignet.[ViceVirtue_Content]
column6: Un personaje contento estará satisfecho con su suerte en la vida. Eso los convierte en vasallos leales, aunque inadecuados para asuntos de intriga.[ViceVirtue_Content]

column2: Trusting characters make poor spymasters, but good friends.[ViceVirtue_Trusting]
column3: Ce personnage est un excellent ami mais un piètre maître-espion.[ViceVirtue_Trusting]
column4: Treuherzige Charaktere sind schlechte Hofspitzel, aber gute Freunde.[ViceVirtue_Trusting]
column6: Los personajes confiados no sirven para jefe de espías, pero son amigos excepcionales.[ViceVirtue_Trusting]

column2: This character never shies from personal danger, enjoying the respect of vassals but the envy of cravens.[ViceVirtue_Brave]
column3: Ce brave ne baisse jamais les bras face au danger. Il suscite le respect des vassaux, tout comme l'envie des lâches.[ViceVirtue_Brave]
column4: Dieser Charakter scheut niemals vor Gefahren für das eigene Leben zurück. Dies bringt ihm den Respekt der Vasallen und den Neid der Feiglinge ein.[ViceVirtue_Brave]
column6: Este personaje nunca elude el peligro. Los vasallos lo respetan y los cobardes lo envidian.[ViceVirtue_Brave]

column2: This character believes in the virtue of 'Temperantia', moderation - a valuable trait in rulers and Stewards.[ViceVirtue_Temperate]
column3: Ce personnage croit en la vertu de la modération, 'temperantia' en latin, un trait de caractère précieux pour les intendants et les souverains.[ViceVirtue_Temperate]
column4: Dieser Charakter glaubt an die Tugend der "Temperantia", der Mäßigung. Dies ist für Herrscher und Kämmerer eine wertvolle Eigenschaft.[ViceVirtue_Temperate]
column6: Este personaje cree en la virtud de la moderación o 'temperantia', valiosa característica en soberanos y administradores.[ViceVirtue_Temperate]

column2: The character is infamously greedy. 'Avaritia', the third deadly sin, while not respected, does help squeeze out some extra tax income.[ViceVirtue_Greedy]
column3: Ce personnage est notoirement radin. L'avarice, 'avaritia' en latin, est le troisième péché capital. Parfait percepteur, il ne force pas le respect.[ViceVirtue_Greedy]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist für seine Gier berüchtigt, also "Avaritia", die dritte Todsünde. Er wird zwar nicht geschätzt, kann aber für zusätzliche Steuereinnahmen sorgen.[ViceVirtue_Greedy]
column6: El personaje es vergonzosamente codicioso. 'Avaritia' es el tercer pecado capital y, aunque no está bien visto, siempre viene bien para obtener unos ingresos extra.[ViceVirtue_Greedy]

column2: This character is famously charitable. 'Caritas' is the third of the seven virtues and a most chivalrous trait.[ViceVirtue_Charitable]
column3: La charité, 'caritas' en latin, est la troisième vertu. Ce personnage est connu pour sa bienveillance et sa générosité.[ViceVirtue_Charitable]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist für seine Wohltätigkeit berühmt. "Caritas" ist die dritte der sieben Tugenden und eine höchst ritterliche Eigenschaft.[ViceVirtue_Charitable]
column6: Este personaje es famoso por su generosidad. 'Caritas' es la tercera de las siete virtudes y un rasgo de caballerosidad.[ViceVirtue_Charitable]

column2: This character is shockingly lazy. 'Acedia', the fourth deadly sin, is an altogether negative trait.[ViceVirtue_Slothful]
column3: La paresse, 'acedia' en latin, est le quatrième péché capital et aucune vertu ne la rachète. Elle est particulièrement mal vue.[ViceVirtue_Slothful]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist erschreckend faul. "Acedia", die vierte Todsünde, ist eine durch und durch negative Eigenschaft.[ViceVirtue_Slothful]
column6: Este personaje es sorprendentemente vago. 'Acedia', es el cuarto pecado capital y, sin excepción, se considera algo negativo.[ViceVirtue_Slothful]

column2: This character is dutiful and diligent, the fourth of the seven virtues - 'Industria'.[ViceVirtue_Diligent]
column3: Le travail, 'industria' en latin, est la quatrième vertu. Ce personnage ne ménage pas sa peine pour travailler durement et remplir les devoirs de son rang.[ViceVirtue_Diligent]
column4: Diesem Charakter ist Pflicht und Fleiß wichtig - "Industria", die vierte der sieben Tugenden.[ViceVirtue_Diligent]
column6: Este personaje es responsable y trabajador, y representa la cuarta de las siete virtudes: 'industria'.[ViceVirtue_Diligent]

column2: This character is envious, the sixth deadly sin - 'Invidia'.[ViceVirtue_Envious]
column3: L'envie, 'invidia' en latin, est le sixième péché capital.[ViceVirtue_Envious]
column4: Dieser Charakter wird vom Neid verzehrt - "Invidia", der sechsten Todsünde[ViceVirtue_Envious]
column6: Este personaje es envidioso y comete el sexto pecado capital: 'invidia'.[ViceVirtue_Envious]

column2: This character is kind and full of empathy. The sixth virtue, 'Humanitas', is popular with vassals, but makes for a rather poor Spymaster.[ViceVirtue_Kind]
column3: Ce personnage est gentil et doué d'empathie. La sixième vertu, 'humanitas' en latin, est très appréciée des vassaux mais fait d'un personnage un piètre maître-espion.[ViceVirtue_Kind]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist gütig und voller Einfühlungsvermögen. Die sechste Tugend, "Humanitas", ist bei Vasallen sehr beliebt. Für Hofspitzel ist sie dagegen eher abträglich.[ViceVirtue_Kind]
column6: Este personaje es amable y derrocha empatía. La sexta virtud, 'humanitas', es popular entre los vasallos, pero es poco útil para jefes de espías.[ViceVirtue_Kind]

column2: The fifth deadly sin is Wrath, 'Ira', and this character certainly has a hot temper.[ViceVirtue_Wroth]
column3: La colère, 'ira' en latin, est le cinquième péché capital. Ce personnage a indéniablement un tempérament fougueux.[ViceVirtue_Wroth]
column4: Der Zorn, "Ira", ist die fünfte Todsünde ... und dieser Charakter hat ganz bestimmt ein hitziges Temperament.[ViceVirtue_Wroth]
column6: El quinto pecado capital es la ira y, por supuesto, este personaje tiene un carácter bastante fuerte.[ViceVirtue_Wroth]

column2: Patience, or 'Patientia', is the fifth of the seven virtues and the opposite of Wrath. Patient characters are just a little bit better at almost everything.[ViceVirtue_Patient]
column3: La patience, 'patientia' en latin, la cinquième vertu. Ce personnage affiche une grande patience et s'avère souvent un peu meilleur que les autres.[ViceVirtue_Patient]
column4: Patientia, die Geduld, ist die fünfte der sieben Tugenden und das Gegenteil des Zorns. Geduldige Charaktere sind fast in allen Belangen ein bisschen besser.[ViceVirtue_Patient]
column6: La paciencia o 'patientia' es la quinta de las siete virtudes y la opuesta a la Ira. Los personajes pacientes son un poco mejor en casi todo.[ViceVirtue_Patient]

column2: This character is a craven and a coward.[ViceVirtue_Craven]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist ein ängstlicher Feigling.[ViceVirtue_Craven]
column6: Este personaje es un gallina y un cobarde.[ViceVirtue_Craven]

column2: This character sees enemies in every shadow, unable to trust anyone.[ViceVirtue_Paranoid]
column3: Ce personnage voit des ennemis partout et n'a confiance en personne.[ViceVirtue_Paranoid]
column4: Dieser Charakter sieht in jedem Schatten einen Feind und kann niemandem vertrauen.[ViceVirtue_Paranoid]
column6: Este personaje ve enemigos en cada rincón, es incapaz de confiar en alguien.[ViceVirtue_Paranoid]

column2: This character is an evil sadist, taking pleasure in the suffering of others.[ViceVirtue_Cruel]
column3: Ce personnage aime voir souffrir ses semblables.[ViceVirtue_Cruel]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist ein boshafter Sadist und genießt es, andere zu quälen.[ViceVirtue_Cruel]
column6: Este personaje es un sádico malvado que siente placer haciendo sufrir a los demás.[ViceVirtue_Cruel]

column2: Lies do not come easily to this character, who values truth above all else. It is not a good trait for spymasters and plotters, but is respected among diplomats.[ViceVirtue_Honest]
column3: Ce personnage ne sait pas mentir et n'aime pas ça. Il fait un piètre maître-espion ou comploteur. En revanche, les diplomates apprécient ce trait.[ViceVirtue_Honest]
column4: Lügen kommen diesem Charakter nicht leicht über die Lippen, denn er schätzt die Wahrheit über alles. Dies ist keine gute Eigenschaft für Hofspitzel und Verschwörer, dafür aber unter Diplomaten geschätzt.[ViceVirtue_Honest]
column6: Rara vez mentirá este personaje, ya que valora la verdad ante todo. No es un buen rasgo para un jefe de espías o un complotador, pero se respeta entre los diplomáticos.[ViceVirtue_Honest]

Well-known to be prone to carnal sins, [GetSheHe] was often unfaithful to [GetHerHis] [GetHusbandWifeOpp]. [wicked_end]
Known to be Gluttonous, [GetSheHe] was constantly eating and rather overweight. [wicked_end]
A Greedy [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] often remarked on the need to tax [GetHerHis] people into space. [wicked_end]
Prone to Sloth, [GetSheHe] never did anything [GetSheHe] did not have to. [wicked_end]
Ever Envious, [GetSheHe] always wanted what other people had. [wicked_end]
A Wroth [GetManWoman], people feared to cross [GetHerHim] - or even bring bad news. [wicked_end]
Guilty of the sin of Pride, [GetSheHe] wanted everyone to know of [GetHerHis] greatness. [wicked_end]
A Chaste [GetManWoman], [GetHerHis] honor was beyond refute. [pious_end]
Ever Temperate, [GetSheHe] never let [GetHerHis] base urges get the better of [GetHerHim]. [pious_end]
Well-known to be Charitable, [GetSheHe] freely gave money to [GetHerHis] friends and family. [pious_end]
A shining example of Diligence, [GetHerHis] duty was never neglected. [pious_end]
Known to be Kind, few had a bad word to say about [GetHerHim]. [pious_end]
A humble [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] never wanted anyone to make a fuss over [GetHerHis] accomplishments. [pious_end]
Never one to cower in the face of battle, [GetSheHe] was a shining pillar of bravery. [pious_end]
Ever seeking wealth, [GetHerHis] gold has purifier [GetHerHis] soul.  [pious_end]
Always seeking to find or steal wealth, [GetSheHe] has lived a life pleasing to Valefar, and surely serves him now
A proud [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] was always ready to tell the tales of [GetHerHis] exploits so others may follow in [GetHerHis] footsteps.  [pious_end]
Having a firm sense of right and wrong, [GetSheHe] was not one to let injustice stand.  [pious_end]
Always setting [GetHerHis] sights on improving [GetHerHis] station, [GetSheHe] has left a strong mark on this world.  [pious_end]
Never present on the battlefield, [GetSheHe] has made a life of fear and cowardice.  [wicked_end]
Known for throwing away [GetHerHis] wealth to the unfortunate and disfavored, [GetSheHe] wasted the potential [GetHerHis] wealth brought [GetHerHim].  [wicked_end]
A humble [GetManWoman], many of [GetHerHis] accomplishments went unnoticed.  [wicked_end]
Prone to rash action and flights of fancy, [GetSheHe] offered no consistency or stability.  [wicked_end]
An unpleasant [GetManWoman], was constantly fearful of imaginary threats to [GetHerHis] reign.  [wicked_end]
A meek [GetManWoman], never had the stomach to do what needed to be done.  [wicked_end]
A cruel [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] never felt as good and when [GetSheHe] was torturing prisoners.  [wicked_end]
A trusting [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] was always willing to give people a change.  [pious_end]
Always fond of fair dealing and eager to tell the truth, few had to worry where they stood with [GetHerHim].  [pious_end]
A true lover of [GetMenWomenPreference], [GetSheHe] was always down for a good tumble.  [pious_end]
Fond of food and drink, [GetSheHe] was constantly throwing memorable banquets and feasts.  [pious_end]
Never one to waste time on activities that did not interest [GetHerHim], others would call [GetHerHim] slothful.  [pious_end]
A wroth [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] was never one to suffer fools, nor to hide their displeasure.  [pious_end]
Always desiring what other people had, [GetSheHe] was never content with just their own gains.  [pious_end]
A strange [GetManWoman] who avoided the intimate pleasures this life can bring.  [wicked_end]
A dull [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] never enjoyed the pleasures of excess or the camaraderie that accompanies great feasts.  [wicked_end]
Always throwing [GetHerHis] full attention into any trivial task, [GetSheHe] had little time for the joys of life.  [wicked_end]
A [GetManWoman] always content to wait for things to happen, [GetSheHe] let many opportunities to seize life pass by.  [wicked_end]
A dynamic [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] seldom wasted time on thought or indecision, preferring immediate action.  [pious_end]
A [GetManWoman] with a taste for power, [GetSheHe] took delight in the personal joys of dominance and torture.  [pious_end]
A [GetManWoman] with no drive or ambition, [GetSheHe] sat by and let others take the opportunities that should have been [GetHersHis].  [wicked_end]

A weak and wicked [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] will surely rot in Hel's domain
